result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dasharrie Marquelle Smith-Washington

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Dasharrie Marquelle Smith-Washington in court.  Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris in court for Dasharrie Marquelle Smith-Washington.  Attorney Patrick T. Franken in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Status Conference. Attorney Harris was recently appointed and has not yet received discovery from prior counsel. Court orders the State to turnover all discovery within 10 days, or by 10/13/2022.  Defense has received and offer from the state and requests adjourned Status Conference.  Attorney Harris and Defendant allowed to appear via zoom for the next hearing.  Case adjourned to Br. 9. Status conference scheduled for November 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Affidavit and order for payment of attorney fees and costs due from Milwaukee County signed.  Filed by:    ADAM  KERNER  $1,790.00
Signed and Filed:  Order for Payment of Attorney Fees and Costs Due from Milwaukee County.

Defendant Dasharrie Marquelle Smith-Washington in court.  Attorney Adam Kerner appeared by video for Dasharrie Marquelle Smith-Washington.  Attorney Patrick T. Franken in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a status of counsel. Defendant requested to seek new counsel and has not retained another attorney at this time. Based upon the defendant's statements, the court found the defendant eligible for appointment of counsel at county expense.  The court appointed Attorney Thomas Harris to represent the defendant; counsel to be paid at the rate of $100.00 per hour. Order Appointing Attorney at County Expense signed and filed. Motion of the defense counsel to withdraw granted by the Court. Court adjourns matter for a status of counsel in Branch 09.
Status conference scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.
/for Extension of Time to File Motions, filed.

Defendant Dasharrie Marquelle Smith-Washington in court with attorney Adam Kerner.  Patrick T. Franken appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Case in Court for Pretrial Conference.  Defendant is requesting new counsel and withdrawal of Attorney Kerner.  The Court takes the motion under advisement.  Defendant advised that newly retained counsel must be present at next hearing date. 
Case adjourned to Br. 9 for Status of counsel hearing.  Status conference scheduled for September 13, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Dasharrie Marquelle Smith-Washington in court with attorney Adam Kerner.  Jon R Josephsen appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court sets 07/01/2022 as the deadline for the State to provide all of the discovery to the defense with the exception of crime lab reports. Court sets 08/08/2022 as the deadline for filing any motions or change of plea forms.  Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective 7/30/22, this case is assigned to branch 9, Judge Paul Van Grunsven in room 632 of the Courthouse.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Dasharrie M Smith-Washington in court with Attorney Adam Kerner; both appear by video.  John Daniel Flynn appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Dasharrie M Smith-Washington in court.  Patrick T. Franken appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court conducted Indigency Hearing. Court held colloquy with defendant. Court found defendant is eligible for appointment of counsel by court. Defendant requested court appointed counsel and agreed to reimburse Milwaukee County for the expense. The court appointed Atty. Adam Kerner, to represent defendant in this matter at County expense and at the rate of $100.00 per hour. The court ordered the defendant repay the County at a rate of $20.00 per month beginning on June 1st, 2022, and then the 1st of each month there after. Court advised defendant failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Signed, Distributed & Filed, Order Appointing Attorney at County Expense. Case adjourned to Branch 17.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Indigency hearing on April 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Dasharrie M Smith-Washington in court.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. Defendant is not eligible for SPD and appears without counsel.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.   Court orders the case adjourned for CAUSE for an Indigency Hearing.  Indigency hearing scheduled for April 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription and no dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Dasharrie M Smith-Washington in court with attorney Helmi Hamad.  Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing. Defense motion to DISMISS Count 1 is DENIED. Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 4, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 3/25/22 @ 2:30p
